messages.messageBody:
>>Hi folks!
> We found out yesterday a bunch of pieces of good news.
> We are in the process of adopting a little girl, Jacqueline
(Jackie), who
> is 5. We have been getting to know each other (learning each
other), and she
> will be coming home to live the weekend after this one. Her
room is ready and
> gorgeous, and we are very excited. >>

Congratulations to all of you! I can't wait to meet your little girl in ABQ. :o)

--
~Mary
http://zenmommasgarden.blogspot.com/

"The miracle is not to walk on water. The miracle is to walk on the
green earth, dwelling deeply in the present moment and feeling truly
alive."
~Thich Nhat Hanh

wrote:
>

> We found out yesterday a bunch of pieces of good news.
> We are in the process of adopting a little girl, Jacqueline
(Jackie), who
> is 5. We have been getting to know each other (learning each
other), and she
> will be coming home to live the weekend after this one. Her
room is ready and
> gorgeous, and we are very excited.

Omigosh!!! That is WONDERFUL news! You brought tears of joy
to my eyes! How cool it must have felt to say "Our Little Girl"!

Thanks for letting us in on all your good news! Happy Day for
you and Beth and Julian and Jackie! What a sweet family!


Sending love,
Marji

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Our Little Girl
messages.msgSnippet: ... This just made me smile.  I m having a fairly crappy day (totally not related to parenting or my children) and this just made me beam for you and Jackie!
messages.messageBody:
On 7/13/06, KathrynJB@... <KathrynJB@...> wrote:

> Two other pieces of good news: First, we are cleared to bring her to
> Albuquerque for the Live and Learn conference. And best of all, we are approved to
> homeschool from the very beginning. She isn't ever going to have to go to
> school unless she wants to. The social workers, to our surprise, had no concerns
> or problems with it, and said it was entirely our decision, as long as we
> complied with the regular state regulations.
> We are psyched!

This just made me smile. I'm having a fairly crappy day (totally not
related to parenting or my children) and this just made me beam for
you and Jackie! Congratulations. I wish I could go to NM to meet
you!

--
Michelle
aka Melbrigða
http://eventualknitting.blogspot.com
MedHS@yahoogroups.com - Homeschooling for the Medieval Recreationist

messages.subject: Our Little Girl
messages.msgSnippet: Hi  folks! We found out yesterday  a bunch of pieces of good news. We are in the process  of adopting a little girl, Jacqueline  (Jackie), who is 5. We have
messages.messageBody:
Hi folks!
We found out yesterday a bunch of pieces of good news.
We are in the process of adopting a little girl, Jacqueline (Jackie), who
is 5. We have been getting to know each other (learning each other), and she
will be coming home to live the weekend after this one. Her room is ready and
gorgeous, and we are very excited.
Two other pieces of good news: First, we are cleared to bring her to
Albuquerque for the Live and Learn conference. And best of all, we are approved to
homeschool from the very beginning. She isn’t ever going to have to go to
school unless she wants to. The social workers, to our surprise, had no concerns
or problems with it, and said it was entirely our decision, as long as we
complied with the regular state regulations.
We are psyched!
Kathryn


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
